definition: (of an actor) to disengage from the performance (e.g. after the show ends)/(of an audience) to lose interest in the performance

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Emilia is the voice of conscience in the play.
sentences.chinese: 埃米莉亚在这出戏中是良知的代言人。
她的这出戏在百老汇不受欢迎。

sentences.english: He acted the principal hero in the play.
He got a free ticket to the play by masquerading as a friend of the actors.
sentences.chinese: 是演员的一位朋友，得到一张免费票看这出戏。

sentences.english: The lighting effects emphasized the atmosphere of the drama.
sentences.chinese: 灯光效果强调出这出戏的气氛。

sentences.english: So, who are the winners in this saga?
sentences.chinese: 那么谁是这出戏的大赢家？

sentences.english: Critics really slapped the play around.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们对那出戏大加挞伐。

sentences.english: The good news for foreign companies is that the game is still early.
sentences.chinese: 对外国公司来说，好消息是这出戏才刚刚拉开序幕。

sentences.english: He got so wound up in the play that his family hardly saw him.
sentences.chinese: 他对演这出戏都着迷了，他家里的人几乎都见不着他。

sentences.english: They made elaborate costumes for the play.
sentences.chinese: 他们为这出戏精心“制作”戏装。

sentences.english: The evening newspaper carried a review of the new play.
sentences.chinese: 晚报上登了一篇关于新上演的那出戏的评论。

sentences.english: They aed to see the play.
Yet the drama may have more twists to come.
sentences.chinese: 但这出戏在将来可能还有更多的曲折。

definition: (of an actor) to inhabit one's role/to become the character/(of an audience) to get involved in the drama
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
unwell/indisposed/out of sorts/euphemism or honorific for ill

(TV or movie) blooper/continuity error/(theater) to flub one's lines/unintended exposure of a body part/to be exposed (of a scheme or trick)/to reveal sth one intended to conceal through a slip of the tongue/to blow one's cover
to quit watching a TV series
(Chinese opera) to play a role outside of one's specialty/(modern) to play a transvestite role/to masquerade as an opponent
